Description: 15.928  BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P23AS00469TO ASSIST STATES AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES ACQUIRE AND PRESERVE THREATENED BATTLEFIELD LAND FROM THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR, WAR OF 1812, AND CIVIL WAR. THIS GRANT PROGRAM ENABLES THE PERMANENT PROTECTION OF HISTORIC BATTLEFIELD LANDS THROUGH FEE SIMPLE ACQUISITION OR THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF AN INTEREST IN THE LAND THROUGH A PRESERVATION COVENANT. STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES ARE ELIGIBLE TO APPLY, AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS OFTEN SUPPORT THE APPLICANT AGENCY IN THE BATTLEFIELD PRESERVATION EFFORT. THE GRANTS REQUIRE A DOLLAR-FOR-DOLLAR NON-FEDERAL MATCH. THE ABPP ADMINISTERS BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTS USING FUNDS APPROPRIATED FROM THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND. TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR ACQUISITION, LAND MUST BE AT LEAST 50  WITHIN THE BOUNDARY OF ONE OF THE 384 BATTLEFIELDS IDENTIFIED IN THE 1993 REPORT ON THE NATION S CIVIL WAR BATTLEFIELDS, OR ONE OF THE 677 BATTLEFIELDS IDENTIFIED IN THE 2007 REVOLUTIONARY WAR AND WAR OF 1812 HISTORIC PRESERVATION STUDY.AWARD SUMMARY: NON-FEDERAL ACQUISITION OF 94.50-ACRE HOWELL TRACT AT BRICES CROSS ROADS BATTLEFIELD WITH THE AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD TRUST. THE AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD TRUST WILL PURCHASE THE TRACT AND TRANSFER THE CONSERVATION EASEMENT TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ARCHIVES   HISTORY.BENEFICIARIES: STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTSSUB-RECIPIENT: AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD TRUST

15.928  BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P23AS00469TO ASSIST STATES AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES ACQUIRE AND PRESERVE THREATENED BATTLEFIELD LAND FROM THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR, WAR OF 1812, AND CIVIL WAR. THIS GRANT PROGRAM ENABLES THE PERMANENT PROTECTION OF HISTORIC BATTLEFIELD LANDS THROUGH FEE SIMPLE ACQUISITION OR THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF AN INTEREST IN THE LAND THROUGH A PRESERVATION COVENANT. STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES ARE ELIGIBLE TO APPLY, AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS OFTEN SUPPORT THE APPLICANT AGENCY IN THE BATTLEFIELD PRESERVATION EFFORT. THE GRANTS REQUIRE A DOLLAR-FOR-DOLLAR NON-FEDERAL MATCH. THE ABPP ADMINISTERS BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTS USING FUNDS APPROPRIATED FROM THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND. TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR ACQUISITION, LAND MUST BE AT LEAST 50  WITHIN THE BOUNDARY OF ONE OF THE 384 BATTLEFIELDS IDENTIFIED IN THE 1993 REPORT ON THE NATION S CIVIL WAR BATTLEFIELDS, OR ONE OF THE 677 BATTLEFIELDS IDENTIFIED IN THE 2007 REVOLUTIONARY WAR AND WAR OF 1812 HISTORIC PRESERVATION STUDY.AWARD SUMMARY: NON-FEDERAL ACQUISITION OF 41.02-ACRE NEW MARKET ROAD TRACT AT MALVERN HILL BATTLEFIELD WITH THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF CONSERVATION AND RECREATION. CAPITAL REGION LAND CONSERVANCY (CRLC), SUB-RECIPIENT UNDER THIS AWARD, WILL TRANSFER THE EASEMENT TO THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA BOARD OF HISTORIC RESOURCES. BENEFICIARIES: STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTSSUB-RECIPIENT: CAPITAL REGION LAND CONSERVANCY

15.928  BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P23AS00469TO ASSIST STATES AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES ACQUIRE AND PRESERVE THREATENED BATTLEFIELD LAND FROM THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR, WAR OF 1812, AND CIVIL WAR. THIS GRANT PROGRAM ENABLES THE PERMANENT PROTECTION OF HISTORIC BATTLEFIELD LANDS THROUGH FEE SIMPLE ACQUISITION OR THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF AN INTEREST IN THE LAND THROUGH A PRESERVATION COVENANT. STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES ARE ELIGIBLE TO APPLY, AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS OFTEN SUPPORT THE APPLICANT AGENCY IN THE BATTLEFIELD PRESERVATION EFFORT. THE GRANTS REQUIRE A DOLLAR-FOR-DOLLAR NON-FEDERAL MATCH. THE ABPP ADMINISTERS BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTS USING FUNDS APPROPRIATED FROM THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND. TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR ACQUISITION, LAND MUST BE AT LEAST 50  WITHIN THE BOUNDARY OF ONE OF THE 384 BATTLEFIELDS IDENTIFIED IN THE 1993 REPORT ON THE NATION S CIVIL WAR BATTLEFIELDS, OR ONE OF THE 677 BATTLEFIELDS IDENTIFIED IN THE 2007 REVOLUTIONARY WAR AND WAR OF 1812 HISTORIC PRESERVATION STUDY.AWARD SUMMARY: NON-FEDERAL ACQUISITION OF 86.36-ACRE MCQUISTON-MALLOY TRACT AT WYSE FORK BATTLEFIELD WITH THE AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD TRUST. THE AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD TRUST WILL PURCHASE THE TRACT AND WILL CONVEY A CONSERVATION EASEMENT TO THE NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES.BENEFICIARIES: STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTSSUB-RECIPIENT: AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD TRUST

THE AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD TRUST HAS ENGAGED IN PURCHASE NEGOTIATIONS WITH EACH OF THE TRACT OWNERS AND INTENDS TO TRANSFER THE CONSERVATION EASEMENTS TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ARCHIVES   HISTORY. TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR ACQUISITION, LAND MUST BE AT LEAST 50  WITHIN THE BOUNDARY OF ONE OF THE 384 BATTLEFIELDS IDENTIFIED IN THE 1993 REPORT ON THE NATION-S CIVIL WAR BATTLEFIELDS, OR ONE OF THE 677 BATTLEFIELDS IDENTIFIED IN THE 2007 REVOLUTIONARY WAR AND WAR OF 1812 HISTORIC PRESERVATION STUDY.AWARD SUMMARY: NON-FEDERAL ACQUISITION OF 0.92-ACRE SHAF TRACTS AT ANTIETAM BATTLEFIELD WITH THE SAVE HISTORIC ANTIETAM FOUNDATION. LAND IS HELD BY THE SAVE HISTORIC ANTIETAM FOUNDATION AS SUB-RECIPIENT. EASEMENT TO BE HELD BY WASHINGTON COUNTY, MARYLAND.BENEFICIARIES: STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTSSUB-RECIPIENT: SAVE HISTORIC ANTIETAM FOUNDATION
